snippet: The Ministry of Education decided not to include the novel “Borderlife” by Dorit Rabinyan for high school literature classes, setting off a debate.
abstract: Israel's Ministry of Education decides to exclude Dorit Rabinyan novel Borderlife, which explores romance between Israeli woman and Palestinian man, from required reading list for Hebrew high school literature classes, noting its inclusion during time of heightened tensions 'could do more harm than good'; move triggers debate, with right-wing groups supporting decision and left-wing groups denouncing it.
lead_paragraph: The Ministry of Education decided not to include the novel “Borderlife” by Dorit Rabinyan for high school literature classes, setting off a debate.

headline.main: Jewish-Arab Love Story Excluded From Israeli Classrooms
headline.print_headline: Jewish-Arab Love Story Is Kept Off Curriculum
